com.bensherman.rtlsdrdjava.tcpcli

Class TcpClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.bensherman.rtlsdrdjava.tcpcli.TcpClient
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class TcpClient
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.util.concurrent.BlockingQueue<Message> completedMsgQueue
      When a client writes a message to the server, once the response has been retrieved, this queue is updated with the Message instance describing the pair.
      private boolean keepAlive
      When this is set to false, if the thread containing this client instance is interrupted, the thread will die.
      static int RTLSDRD_DEFAULT_TCP_PORT_NUMBER
      Default port number used by rtlsdrd
      private static java.lang.String SOCKET_READER_THREAD_NAME
      Name to be given to the thread associated with the socketWriter instance.
      private static java.lang.String SOCKET_WRITER_THREAD_NAME
      Name to be given to the thread associated with the socketWriter instance.
      private TcpSocketReader socketReader
      The instance of TcpSocketReader associated with this client, which is used to handle socket reads.
      private java.lang.Thread socketReaderThread
      The thread which the socketReader instance is running in
      private TcpSocketWriter socketWriter
      The instance of TcpSocketWriter associated with this client, which is used to handle socket writes.
      private java.lang.Thread socketWriterThread
      The thread which the socketWriter instance is running in.
      private static java.lang.String TCP_CLIENT_DEFAULT_THREAD_NAME
      The name that the user should call this client
      private java.net.Socket tcpSocket
      Socket used to interact w/ the server
      private static int THREAD_JOIN_WAIT_TIME_MS
      When terminate() is called, the TcpSocketWriter and TcpSocketReader threads will have this parameter as their join() timeout.

      • tcpSocket

        private final java.net.Socket tcpSocket
        Socket used to interact w/ the server

      • socketWriter

        private final TcpSocketWriter socketWriter
        The instance of TcpSocketWriter associated with this client, which is used to handle socket writes.

      • socketReader

        private final TcpSocketReader socketReader
        The instance of TcpSocketReader associated with this client, which is used to handle socket reads.

      • socketWriterThread

        private final java.lang.Thread socketWriterThread
        The thread which the socketWriter instance is running in.

      • socketReaderThread

        private final java.lang.Thread socketReaderThread
        The thread which the socketReader instance is running in

      • completedMsgQueue

        private final java.util.concurrent.BlockingQueue<Message> completedMsgQueue
        When a client writes a message to the server, once the response has been retrieved, this queue is updated with the Message instance describing the pair. Note that this is a blocking queue which will endlessly grow if not tended to. TODO HAVE A LISTENER WHICH PULLS MESSAGES FROM THIS QUEUE

      • keepAlive

        private boolean keepAlive
        When this is set to false, if the thread containing this client instance is interrupted, the thread will die.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TcpClient

        public TcpClient(java.lang.String hostname,
                 int portNum)
          throws java.net.UnknownHostException,
                 java.io.IOException
        Instantiates a new TcpClient
        Parameters:
        hostname - The hostname of the server (can be an IP or textual name to be resolved w/ DNS)
        portNum - The port number to connect to on the server
        Throws:
        java.net.UnknownHostException - If the host's IP address couldn't be determined
        java.io.IOException - If there was an error creating the socket, which can also occur during the instantiation of socketWriter and socketReader

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        When this TcpClient is run as a thread, this function will be called. This function then starts the each of the socketWriter and socketReader threads.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • logMsg

        private void logMsg(java.lang.String msg)
        Logs/outputs a message. Replace the System.out.println() with a logger if desired. The message format is ": msg"
        Parameters:
        msg - The msg to log

      • sendToServer

        public void sendToServer(java.lang.String msg)
        Writes a message to the server. This happens asynchronously.
        Parameters:
        msg - The message to send to the server

      • terminateSocketWriterThread

        private void terminateSocketWriterThread()
                                  throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Requests that the socketWriter thread die. The join() call will wait THREAD_JOIN_WAIT_TIME_MS.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - If this thread is interrupted when calling join()

      • terminateSocketReaderThread

        private void terminateSocketReaderThread()
                                  throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Requests that the socketReader thread die. The join() call will wait THREAD_JOIN_WAIT_TIME_MS.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - If this thread is interrupted when calling join()

      • terminate

        public void terminate()
               throws java.io.IOException,
                      java.lang.InterruptedException
        Stops the TcpClient thread as well as the TcpSocketWriter and TcpSocketReader threads. The socket is also closed. This TcpClient should NOT be used after executing this function. The socket is closed in order to wake the reader thread.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an IO error occurs when closing tcpSocket
        java.lang.InterruptedException - If this thread is interrupted when terminating either of the reader or writer threads.

      • addToCompletedMsgQueue

        void addToCompletedMsgQueue(Message completedMsg)
        Add a completed Message instance (i.e. its response fields are set) to the completedMsgQueue.
        Parameters:
        completedMsg - A completed Message to add to completedMsgQueue

      • getCompletedMessage

        public Message getCompletedMessage()
                            throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        THIS CALL BLOCKS on completedMsgQueue. That is, if this function is called when completedMsgQueue is empty, the calling thread will wait until a Message becomes available.
        Returns:
        The head of the completedMsgQueue queue, which is the oldest completed Message which has not been pulled from the queue.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - If the calling thread is interrupted when waiting on completedMsgQueue.

      • getTcpSocketReader

        TcpSocketReader getTcpSocketReader()
        Returns this TcpClient's socketReader member. Intended to be used only by the socketWriter instance.
        Returns:
        This TcpClient's socketReader member.

      • getCompletedMessageQueueLength

        public int getCompletedMessageQueueLength()
        Returns:
        The number of completed messages waiting to be received using getCompletedMessage()

      • getDefaultThreadName

        public static java.lang.String getDefaultThreadName()
        Returns:
        The default name for the thread executing this class's run() method.
